You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Upgrade B2B Commerce for Visualforce to a New Release or Patch

To upgrade an existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce implementation, install the new version of the managed package and load the latest configuration and custom settings data. Then, review the release notes for all versions along your upgrade path, and complete the appropriate upgrade steps as necessary. If you're installing a patch, also check the notes for each patch released for the major version you installed for any extra upgrade steps.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Prepare Your Existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce Data for Upgrade
To help make sure that your upgrade experience is smooth and successful, first clean up some existing data and settings in your org.
Upgrade the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package
Install the release or patch build of the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package that you're upgrading to.
Update External Access Sharing Settings for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Custom Objects
A critical update in Salesforce Summer ’19 automatically sets the organization-wide default (OWD) external access settings for some B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects to Private. If you leave these settings unchanged, both registered and guest users can't access some content on your storefront. If your org was created after Salesforce Summer ’19, update the OWD external access settings for the affected objects.
Create Metadata for the Namespace List Configuration Added in a Patch
Some patches for B2B Commerce for Visualforce add a reference to a new storefront configuration setting that uses the API name ui.nsList. If you're upgrading to one of these patches, manually create the appropriate metadata before you can set the configuration setting on your storefront.
SEE ALSO
Install the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package
Assign Permissions for Storefront Admins
Build, Activate, or Deactivate a Configuration Cache

title: Upgrading Salesforce B2B Commerce for Visualforce
